title: How to Make Recuperative Chicken Soup for Cold Rainy Days

steps.headline: Bring two boxes of chicken stock to a boil in a large pot.
Rinse and clean two medium size chicken breasts.
steps.description: Ensure all the fat has been removed.

steps.headline: Cut chicken in to bite size pieces, lightly salt and pepper, and boil in the stock till no longer pink in the middle and cooked through.
Once the chicken is cooked through add all your vegetables to the pot and cook until crisp tender.
In a separate pot, cook your egg noodles, following the instructions, until al dente.
steps.description: Once noodles are done, drain and add them to the chicken, vegetable, and stock mixture.

steps.headline: Drop temperature to a simmer for about 5 minutes adding salt, pepper, and garlic powder to taste.

text: Bring two boxes of chicken stock to a boil in a large pot.  Gather and prepare your vegetables.  Rinse and clean two medium size chicken breasts. Ensure all the fat has been removed. Cut chicken in to bite size pieces, lightly salt and pepper, and boil in the stock till no longer pink in the middle and cooked through.  Once the chicken is cooked through add all your vegetables to the pot and cook until crisp tender.  In a separate pot, cook your egg noodles, following the instructions, until al dente. Once noodles are done, drain and add them to the chicken, vegetable, and stock mixture. Drop temperature to a simmer for about 5 minutes adding salt, pepper, and garlic powder to taste.  Finished.
